sentences.en: A dentist may decide to extract the tooth to prevent recurrent trouble.
sentences.cn: 牙医可能会决定拔掉那颗牙，以免反复发作。

sentences.en: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.cn: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。
已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.en: He might decide that it is best to induce labour.
I couldn't decide whether he was incredibly brave or just insane.
sentences.cn: 我不能判定他到底是英勇无畏还是精神失常。

sentences.en: I had to decide right then.
It was difficult to decide between the two candidates.
sentences.cn: 很难在这两个候选人之间决定取舍。

sentences.en: Little boys, being what they are, might decide to play on it.
sentences.cn: 出于天性，小男孩们可能会决定利用这一点。

sentences.en: Students may decide to seek tutorial guidance.
sentences.cn: 学生可以决定寻求导师指导。

sentences.en: The Commission will have the power to decide disputes.
sentences.cn: 该委员会将有权裁决争端。

sentences.en: The Council will meet to decide if it should accept his resignation.
sentences.cn: 委员会将召开会议决定是否接受他的辞呈。

sentences.en: The judge should not have left it to the jury to decide.
sentences.cn: 法官本不该把案子交给陪审团来裁定。

sentences.en: The judges could not decide which category it belonged in.
sentences.cn: 评委们无法判定它属于哪一类。

sentences.en: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
They wait for the group to decide rather than making individual decisions.
sentences.cn: 他们等待团体作决定而不是各自作出决定。

sentences.en: They're keenly aware that whatever they decide will set a precedent.
sentences.cn: 他们深知无论他们的决定是什么，都将开创先例。

sentences.en: We will be having a meeting to decide what to do.
sentences.cn: 我们准备开个会来决定怎么办。

sentences.en: West had to decide whether to play a heart.
sentences.cn: 韦斯特必须决定是否要出一张红桃。
你来选吧，我拿不定主意。

决定性的；果断的，坚定的

phrases.tran_cn: 决定不；作出不利于…的判决
作对…有利的决定；赞成做某事

trans.tran_cn: 决定，判决，影响…的结果，下决心，成为（某人）做某事的原因
trans.tran_en: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

trans.tran_cn: 决定， 拿定主意； 判决
